Description: Shoulder sherd of large Corinthian black-figured pottery closed vessel; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of perhaps part of the wing of a mythological creature, to left, with traces of added red and added white dots at ends of feathers; black remains, possibly filling ornament, in field.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For possible parallels, see Boardman 1998, 192-3, fig. 377-8 and fig. 380 (for creatures with wings curling over their backs).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.157) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
